{{Infobox military conflict |conflict= Battle of Bosra |partof= the [[Syrian Civil War]] |image= |caption= |date= 21–25 March 2015
({{Age in months, weeks and days|year1=2015|month1=03|day1=21|year2=2015|month2=03|day2=25}}) |place= [[Bosra]], [[Daraa Governorate]], [[Syria]] |result= Rebel victory * Tension between Islamic Muthanna Movement and al-Sunna lions brigade |territory= * Rebels capture Bosra |combatant1={{flagicon image|Syria-flag 1932-58 1961-63.svg}} [[Free Syrian Army]]
[[Islamic Muthanna Movement (Syrian rebel group)|Islamic Muthanna Movement]]
{{Flagicon image|Flag of the Al-Nusra Front.svg}}[[al-Nusra Front]] |combatant2={{flagicon|Syria}} [[Syrian Arab Republic]] * {{flagicon image|Flag of the Syrian Arab Armed Forces.svg}} [[Syrian Armed Forces]] * {{flagicon image|InfoboxNDF.png}} [[National Defense Force (Syria)|National Defense Force]] {{flagicon image|InfoboxHez.PNG}} [[Hezbollah]]
{{flagicon image|Flag of Iran.svg}} [[Army of the Guardians of the Islamic Revolution|Iranian IRGC]]
{{flagicon image|Flag of Iraq.svg}} Imam al-Hussein Brigade{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/archicivilians/status/584039957334896640|title=archicivilians on Twitter|work=Twitter|accessdate=16 April 2015}} |commander1= Gen. [[Bashar al-Zoubi]]
(Southern Front leader)
[[Ahmad Alouda]]
(Shabab alsunna brigade leader) |commander2= Abu Kadhim Khudr{{KIA}}
(Imam al-Hussein Brigade commander) |units1={{flagicon image|Syria-flag 1932-58 1961-63.svg}} [[Southern Front (Syrian rebel group)|Southern Front]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2015/Mar-25/292083-syria-rebels-storm-idlib-city-in-three-pronged-attack.ashx|title=Syria rebels storm Idlib city in three-pronged attack|work=The Daily Star Newspaper - Lebanon|accessdate=25 March 2015}} *[[Omari Brigades]]{{cite web|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/security/2015/03/syria-jabhat-nusra-bosra-tikrit-fronts-fighting-offensives.html#|title=Jabhat al-Nusra looks for battlefield breakout - Al-Monitor: the Pulse of the Middle East|work=Al-Monitor|accessdate=16 April 2015}} * [[Lions of Sunna Brigade]] |units2={{flagicon|Syria}} 52nd Brigade
{{flagicon|Syria}} 17th Brigade |strength1= |strength2= |casualties1=21–25 killed |casualties2=Unknown |casualties3=4 civilians killed{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/14-members-of-the-regime-forces-and-islamic-battalions-killed-in-daraa-and-al-suwaydaa/ |title=14 members of the regime forces and Islamic battalions killed in Daraa and al- Suwaydaa |author=sohranas |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=25 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150325000906/http://syriahr.com:80/en/2015/03/14-members-of-the-regime-forces-and-islamic-battalions-killed-in-daraa-and-al-suwaydaa/ |archivedate=25 March 2015 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/the-opposition-shells-kill-16-people-in-aleppo-and-idlib-while-12-fighters-died-in-daraa/ |title=The opposition shells kill 16 people in Aleppo and Idlib, while 12 fighters died in Daraa |author=sohranas |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=25 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402092005/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/the-opposition-shells-kill-16-people-in-aleppo-and-idlib-while-12-fighters-died-in-daraa/ |archivedate=2 April 2015 |df= }} }} {{Campaignbox Syrian Civil War}} The '''Battle of Bosra''' refers to a military operation launched by Syrian rebels during the [[Syrian Civil War]], in order to capture the city of [[Bosra]]. ==The battle== On 21 March 2015, the offensive was launched by rebels on Syrian Army positions in and around Bosra. On 24 March 2015, rebels advanced in the town and besieged a number of soldiers in the ancient citadel, which the Army regained after a counter-attack.{{cite web|url=http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/the-syrian-arab-army-regains-full-control-over-the-busra-al-sham-castle-fierce-clashes-ongoing/|title=The Syrian Arab Army Regains Full Control Over the Busra Al-Sham Castle; Fierce Clashes Ongoing|author=Leith Fadel|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=25 March 2015}} The Syrian Air Force launched ten airstrikes on the town, while 30 barrel bombs were also dropped that day.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/2015/03/%D9%86%D8%AD%D9%88-40-%D8%BA%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A9-%D9%88%D8%A8%D8%B1%D9%85%D9%8A%D9%84-%D9%86%D9%81%D8%B0%D9%87%D8%A7-%D9%88%D8%A3%D9%84%D9%82%D8%A7%D9%87%D8%A7-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B7%D9%8A%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86/|title=نحو 40 غارة وبرميل نفذها وألقاها الطيران الحربي والمروحي على بصرى الشام والمقاتلون يتقدمون في البلدة|author=المرصد السوري|work=المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان|accessdate=25 March 2015}} The Army also fired rockets on the nearby Maaraba hospital, where injured rebels were being treated, which completely levelled the building.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/03/syria-rebels-seize-bosra-sham-150325191523360.html|title=Syria rebels seize ancient town near Jordanian border|publisher=Al Jazeera English|accessdate=16 April 2015}} On 25 March 2015, FSA rebels backed by Islamist factions captured the town and its UNESCO archaeological sites.{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/rebel-and-islamic-battalions-take-control-on-busra-al-sham/ |title=Rebel and Islamic battalions take control on Busra al-Sham |author=Master |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=25 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402095659/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/rebel-and-islamic-battalions-take-control-on-busra-al-sham/ |archivedate=2 April 2015 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/03/25/us-mideast-crisis-syria-town-idUSKBN0ML0O320150325|title=Mainstream Syrian rebels seize historic town in south: monitor|work=Reuters|accessdate=25 March 2015}} According to a pro-government source, Army and militia units retreated from their positions in the town after the promised reinforcements were not deployed.[http://syriadirect.org/main/37-videos/1939-roman-era-town-falls-to-rebels ROMAN-ERA TOWN FALLS TO REBELS] ==Aftermath== On 29 March, local clashes took place in Glen town between the Islamic Muthanna Movement and al-Sunna lions brigade after an "argument" occurred about dividing the seized weapons and ammunition from Bosra. One fighter from the Islamic Muthanna Movement was killed, while three fighters were injured from both sides in the clashes.{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/clashes-between-2-islamic-battalions-in-dara-countryside/ |title=Clashes between 2 Islamic battalions in Dar’a countryside |author=Master |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=16 April 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403042037/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/clashes-between-2-islamic-battalions-in-dara-countryside/ |archivedate=3 April 2015 |df= }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{coord|32.5181|N|36.4817|E|source:wikidata|display=title}} {{Syrian Civil War}} [[Category:Daraa Governorate in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2015|Bosra 2015]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Free Syrian Army]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the al-Nusra Front|Bosra 2015]] [[Category:Bosra]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Hezbollah|Bosra 2015]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Quds Force]]
